Description: Body sherd from lower bowl of Attic black-figure painted pottery cassel cup; rays and diagonal strokes between parallel lines. Inside, a reserved circle which is interrupted by a narrow black band.
Curator's comments: Accompanying label states: "Fragment of cassel cup. Attic. Third quarter of 6thC BC. Found at Tell Defenneh. CV8 pl.100,33".
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 608, 33)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 90)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.119, p.120, fig.3)
